#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Why did you choose a free license ?

#Text=People are spending more money , time and attention on playing computer games than ever before , and games are constantly evolving into a more nuanced medium of expression and a greater part of our culture .
#Text=Just observe how much people play on Facebook and their mobile devices .
#Text=We think this culture should allow gamers to learn how their games work , change them , share them and redistribute their works .
#Text=This freedom to tinker is what Free , Open-Source Software ( FOSS ) is all about and so we hope a lot of people tinker with 0 A.D.
#Text=A city , as shown within the game .
#Text=Image : Robert Schultz de Plainsboro .
#Text=How do you coordinate ?
#Text=What technical and financial resources has 0 A.D. ?
#Text=We mostly coordinate over a forum system we have , as well as a Trac system for task management and technical documentation .
#Text=We also conduct discussions over IRC ( #0ad and #0ad-dev on QuakeNet ) , that get more concentrated on the weekend , and Saturday afternoon in particular , when we have our weekly meeting .
#Text=Which type of participants do you need ?
#Text=' Amateurs '
#Text=can they participate ?
#Text=Amateurs can definitely help with tasks like documentation and spreading the word about 0 A.D.
#Text=For other tasks , we do require some prior knowledge in fields such as software development , 3d animation etc.
#Text=Our main personnel needs are in three fields : Programmers , artists and sound people .
#Text=We have many applicants for sound contributors but need a manager to oversee them .
#Text=For programming we need capable gameplay , AI , sound and graphics programmers , proficient in C++ and/or JavaScript .
#Text=Finally , in the art department , we could use some more texture artists , 3D artists , animators , and illustrators to draw 2d icons for the game 's user interface .
#Text=It 's been 10 years since 0 A.D. is developing , what obstacles have arisen and how have you resolved ?
#Text=The biggest obstacle we have run into is underestimating the scale and complexity of an RTS game .
#Text=When embarking upon this journey in 2001 , nobody thought that completing this endeavor would take this long .
#Text=Evidently , making an RTS game requires a great deal of programming features , art assets and more .
#Text=And , as we discovered the hard way , the first draft of anything is seldom good enough .
#Text=For example , one of the most important engine components , named " Simulation " , was simply planned wrong the first time around .

column1: #Text=Simulation is in charge of changing the state of each entity in the " world " represented in the game , like handling harvesting resources , doing damage to stuff and handling death .
#Text=Sadly , over time it got implemented in such a haphazard way it devolved into an unstable , unpredictable ball of mud .
#Text=Debugging became difficult and attracting new programmers from joining the development effort became impossible .
#Text=Over time , fewer and fewer developers stayed on with 0 A.D. and it seemed as if the project was in grave danger of ending , the way many initiatives on the internet spontaneously do .
